title: Ellen DeGeneres explains how a Hollywood liberal can be friends with a conservative ex-president
text:
If Ellen and Dubya can pull it off, maybe there’s hope for the rest of us.

‘I’m friends with George Bush. In fact, I’m friends with a lot of people who don’t share the same beliefs that I have. Just because I don’t agree with someone on everything doesn’t mean that I’m not going to be friends with them. When I say be kind to one another, I don’t mean only the people that think the same way that you do. I mean be kind to everyone.”

Ellen DeGeneres, a self-proclaimed “gay Hollywood liberal,” was responding to the firestorm that erupted across social media when she was spotted sitting next to former president George W. Bush at a Dallas Cowboys game on Sunday.

“People were upset,” she said in a segment slated to air on Tuesday. “A lot of people were mad, and they did what people do when they’re mad: They tweet.”

Indeed they do. Twitter TWTR, -1.62% was filled with tweets like this:

is it so bad that ellen and george bush are friends? is it so terrible, in these polarising times, to cross the aisle in the spirit of friendship and shared humanity and crack jokes with a guy responsible for the deaths of between 500,000 and 1,000,000 iraqis? — thomas violence (@thomas_violence) October 8, 2019

DeGeneres explained that she and her wife, Portia de Rossi, were invited to the game by Charlotte Jones, the daughter of Cowboys owner Jerry Jones.

Here’s her full take on the backlash:

Yes, that was me at the Cowboys game with George W. Bush over the weekend. Here’s the whole story. pic.twitter.com/AYiwY5gTIS — Ellen DeGeneres (@TheEllenShow) October 8, 2019
